name: supplant
content:

to replace: Printed books will soon be supplanted by e-books. Small children can often feel supplanted in their parents' affections (= that their parents no longer like them as much) when a new brother or sister is born. Synonyms
replace (CHANGE FOR)
supersede

to take the place of (something or someone): Travel videos do not supplant guidebooks, but they can be useful when planning a trip.
